RT @EnvDefenseFund Climate change is a major financial risk to the U.S. economy. But unlike other financial risks, it‚Äôs not routinely disclosed to the public. This new group wants to change that. https://twitter.com/Michael_Panfil/status/1404506926097080324 QT @Michael_Panfil Excited to be taking part in the newly formed @ClimateRiskLaw, an initiative of @EnvDefenseFund, @SabinCenter, @PolicyIntegrity, and @vanderbiltlaw. As the consequences of climate change increase, the ability to identify risk and build resilience will be critical.

If we don‚Äôt take #ClimateAction, we will have to grapple with crumbling infrastructure, an endangered economy, and severe weather, like hurricanes and wildfires.

I joined @ASP and @RepDonBacon to discuss why we need #ClimateAction. Now. https://twitter.com/RepCasten/status/1403089727885033473 QT @RepCasten Extreme weather events caused nearly $95 billion in damage in 2020 alone. I joined @ASP and @RepDonBacon to discuss how extreme weather events and climate change have a devastating impact on our economy. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1403086003288543232/img/Q0IcMibqzou0Grpy.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1403086003288543232/vid/480x270/DOaGwx4JuftSZJ4-.mp4?tag=14
You can read my full statement here: https://casten.house.gov/media/press-releases/casten-warren-submit-comments-sec-require-public-companies-disclose-climate

We must establish clear climate disclosure standards that empower investors to make smarter decisions, reduce the risk of environmental & financial catastrophes, and harness the power of free markets to ease the transition from fossil fuels to cleaner, cheaper energy sources.
The SEC must mandate climate risk disclosure for public companies. The current voluntary framework is not sufficient for investors to fully understand the risk they are exposed to.

Despite the escalating calls for action from scientists, economists, business leaders, and investors, the U.S. is far behind our global partners in safeguarding our financial system against this grave and imminent climate threat.

From the wildfires, droughts, blackouts, and superstorms that have already caused over $500 billion in damages in the past four years to rising sea levels & crop failures, the climate crisis is causing real, measurable declines in our economic output & increased systemic risk.

DOJ‚Äôs report on #PuertoRico‚Äôs political status confirms that within the U.S. Constitution only two options are available: to become a state or remain as a territory. The other alternative outside of U.S. sovereignty is independence.

Critical habitat designations impact land management & economic development throughout the West. 

We need scientifically-sound, responsible policies - not government overreach and regulatory red tape. #WCSpeciesWeek

In 2021, the Trump Admin revised the designation to empower local management on 3.5 million acres in WA, OR, & CA.

The Biden Admin is refusing to implement this revision & @RepBentz is fighting back on behalf of his constituents. #WCSpeciesWeek

The critical habitat designation for the northern spotted owl was revised to include millions of acres that are NOT inhabited by the owl.

Only the habitat of a species should be eligible for a critical habitat designation. #WCSpeciesWeek

In 2018, the Supreme Court agreed.

The ESA listing of the spotted owl has an enormous impact on PNW communities. #WCSpeciesWeek

I believe it is time for a course correction on U.S. policy toward Venezuela. It is time to stop using the well-being of the Venezuelan people as a bargaining chip.

The Biden administration must find other ways to pursue its foreign policy goals.

While U.S. officials debate the sanctions policy in Washington, for people in Venezuela the ongoing crisis is a life-and-death matter.

Sanctions should never be used to punish whole populations for the actions of their leaders or to bludgeon an adversary into submission.

Unlike smart sanctions that target the behavior of specific individuals, the impact of sectoral and secondary sanctions is indiscriminate, and purposely so.

The percentage of Venezuelans living in poverty increased from 48% in 2014 to 96% in 2019, with 80% in extreme poverty.
